ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] *sighs*
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Judy Tyrer wrote: THANK YOU! Yes, one of my pet peeves with the game is how drastically each class changes from the early levels to the higher levels. As
ygData.messageBody:
Judy Tyrer wrote:

THANK YOU! Yes, one of my pet peeves with the game is how drastically each class changes from the early levels to the higher levels.  As my betrothed (if he ever returns /em pouts) is a ranger I am all too familiar with the difficulties of that class.  (Oh, and Druids do wear green armor once they get their vermiculite - we look like rangers in green mail and rangers are in green plate).

At the time I was using that line, no one had vermiculite. <grin>

 Did you participate in last weekends Ranger Protest?  Apparently rangers from all the servers made level 1 wood-elves, formed a guild called "Wrath of Rangers", and descended on Crushbone.  Would have loved to have seen it. 
Nope, I've participated in others, though, and was able to see some of the top rangers who had been playing since Closed Beta (2 as well as 3)... really respected names in the community who'd already made it, and were no longer active as rangers, but wanted to help others.  it was a great experience to be in on the first one in May, and to be there for the planning stages and everything. The Ranger's Glade forum is an excellent site (part of EQForge) and very active in ranger concerns.  I had to make a clean break, however, because I really did have alot of emotion tied up in EQ, and when I quit, it was very difficult... I mean, I dragged my real-life best friend into it so we could 'see' each other every day... my ingame partner has become my out-of-game partner, too... (looooooooong story, hehe, and I wouldn't recommend it as a way to pick up guys) so you can see why I would just want to turn my back on being active in the cause when that really isn't typical behavior for me.
 But to be honest, I still think Rangers rock.  I could be prejudiced ;-) 
I do, too, honestly, but it's the rest of the world that needs convincing... <sigh>  I didn't quit because I wasn't 'winning'; I did it because Verant told a community of customers to screw off.
 As for my game, I'm now stuck on how to get away from "killing mobs" as the primary gameplay force.  I want it more adventure based, I think, with characters given "opportunities" to alter the dynamic of gameplay.  And each level grouping having different quest orientations.  And each server being uniquely itself because of the decisions made by players up to that time. Anyway, the game is now called KARMA and when you die - you REALLY die ;-)  None of this resurrection gorp.  You have to be reborn and how you are reborn is totally dependent on how you played up to that point.  Of course, like anything else, it's all in the details.  But those are my ideas so far.  Opinions? Judy

 
I recommend you steal a page from the original Ultima series, then, and have quests and decisions actually count for 'Karma' points... in the Ultima series, if your avatar behaved a certain way, individual NPCs might or might not choose to adventure with him.  Everything was a consequence of his actions.  So, if a KARMA avatar did things according to how his alignment and class should behave in a given situation, he should get karma points.  Depending on how many Karma points he has, he might have a higher 'fame' rating in how NPCs deal with him (one of the things I liked about UO; NPC shopkeeps would lower prices for higher famed players), but it will also determine how he is reborn... just things to consider. =)

Also, I like the idea of being reborn.  I think, at that time, loot should disappear, maybe restored to the database as 'available' for respawn somewhere... that way, people don't get too attached to their stuff?  I have to admit, my EQ and UO banks (and heck, my Diablo stash, hehe) had more sentimental stuff in it than anything else, and it crushed me to have my UO house looted by people who just destroyed the gifts I'd been given if they had no value for use or resale... but maybe there's a lesson in that? <grin>
Keep us posted...

Aelwesara Cûthalion, Ranger, of worlds to come
